header_summary:
In a comprehensive discussion on Bitcoin's transaction methodologies, conduition et al. delved into the complexities and potential benefits of committing script pubkeys to previous outputs for deterministic backup wallets, highlighting the technical challenges for offline or hardware wallets and privacy concerns associated with proving common ownership of UTXOs on-chain. This exploration suggested an alternative approach focusing on stateless address generation and single signature authorization for UTXOs owned by the same entity, raising considerations around privacy trade-offs and on-chain association proofs ([source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/kBNJjQ46doVAAXAOjzIoBdtX4UikDa2YCqKdPbzEK-QjbBUHdl2V_5T-Ay6Z76lnj5BHmrAWg9FS1eHT_PgJmoEFFuPkWt5i8LPEvY3wmKk=@proton.me/T/#m25755116a2ddc8596e42240a5f0ba3125d637e1e)).

Antoine Poinsot reflected on the governance and influence within the Bitcoin ecosystem, emphasizing the voluntary nature of Bitcoin Core's adoption and the decentralized ethos of Bitcoin despite technicalities such as Microsoft's control over GitHub hosting. This discussion underscored the importance of respecting voluntary technology adoption and utilizing proper forums for constructive debate within the Bitcoin community ([source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/73a08ea3-b9be-424b-a1cb-beac3206723cn@googlegroups.com/T/#mc592187c314b71ec233a70cb79a9176bd9262882)).

TheStack commemorated a significant milestone in Bitcoin Core's history, marking ten years since the switch from OpenSSL to libsecp256k1 for ECDSA signature validation, which led to substantial performance enhancements in signature validation. This shift, detailed with benchmarking results, not only improved performance but also set a precedent for continuous optimization within the Bitcoin Core development, highlighting libsecp256k1's superior efficiency and the ongoing efforts to enhance cryptographic operations within the Bitcoin ecosystem ([source](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/comparing-the-performance-of-ecdsa-signature-validation-in-openssl-vs-libsecp256k1-over-the-last-decade/2087)).

Meanwhile, an audit of the Bitcoin archive by 0xB10C revealed discrepancies in the archival process, identifying missing posts and topics, which highlights the challenges of maintaining a complete and accurate digital record of Bitcoin's evolving discussions, serving as a reminder of the importance of diligent archival practices to encapsulate the breadth of discourse within the community ([source](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/public-archive-for-delving-bitcoin/87/7)).

active_posts.title: On (in)ability to embed data into Schnorr
authors: On (in)ability to embed data into Schnorr waxwing/ AdamISZ
active_posts.summary:
- AdamISZ explores the feasibility of data embedding in Schnorr signatures without risking security.
- The analysis concludes that such embedding compromises the private key, affecting UTXO set integrity.
- The study invites critique, emphasizing the importance of privacy and security in cryptographic innovations.

active_posts.title: Concept Review: B-SSL (Bitcoin Secure Signing Layer) — Covenant-Free Vault Model Using Taproot, CSV, and CLTV
active_posts.summary:
- Francesco Madonna introduces **B-SSL** for safer Bitcoin self-custody, preventing key loss.
- It features three recovery paths and uses mirrored backups for added security.
- The project seeks community feedback on its design and safety features before implementation.

today_in_history_posts.title: Draft BIP for SNICKER
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- The email discusses a solution for Bitcoin's watch-only issue involving a coinjoin-tx.
- Adam explains the key tweak `c` must be secretly shared between proposer and receiver, affecting watch-only wallets.
- He also addresses security concerns and finds the discussion on the proposed solution useful.

today_in_history_posts.title: Data Lightning Atomic Swap (DLAS-down, DLAS-up)
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- The proposal introduces Data Lightning Atomic Swap for atomic data and payment exchanges.
- DLAS has two patterns: DLAS-down for data download and DLAS-up for data upload with payment.
- Challenges include expanding data size for DLAS-down and requiring OG AMP for DLAS-up implementation.

today_in_history_posts.title: Segwit Ephemeral Anchors
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Ephemeral Anchors are introduced to include "dusty" values in key-less outputs, relying on Bitcoin's script.
- The mechanism's drawback is its vulnerability to transaction ID malleability without CLEANSTACK rules.
- A proposed solution involves bip141's softfork for a more efficient approach, detailed in a special GitHub branch.
